entry.title: Remove arcore manifest entries from weblayer
entry.content:
These were recently introduced by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4434152



Having the tags in weblayer is harmless, since it's the embedding

app's manifest that needs them, they go unused. However, we have

internal manifest validation checks that ensure these do not exist,

so we remove them here.



The removal is accomplished via manifest merger. To get the manifest

ordering correct, this sorts manifests in write_build_config.py. I

believe this is the first time where order has mattered, but sorting

here seems wise anyways for more consistent results.



Bug: 1434969

entry.title: capture-game: Integrate capture mode behavior with current code
entry.content:
This CL integrates the `CaptureModeBehavior` with current capture mode

code. Active behavior will be created for the capture mode session which

will be passed to the video recording watcher if in video recording mode.

The behavior will be used to decide the capture mode configurations for

different capture mode clients.

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer issues in MediaRouterUiForTestBase.
entry.content:
MediaRouterUiForTestBase currently holds a pointer to a

MediaRouterDialogControllerViews, which is a WebContentsUserData

subclass. However, several MediaRouterUiForTestBase implementations are

also WebContentsUserData subclasses.



This turns out to be problematic for dangling pointers, because the

order of destruction of different WebContentsUserDatas registered with

the same WebContents is *not* guaranteed.



It turns out that the various MediaRouterUiForTestBase subclasses don't

need to be WebContentsUserData and can simply be strongly owned by the

test fixture instead. This fixes the dangling pointer errors triggered

by the undefined order of destruction of WebContentsUserDatas, and, as a

bonus, fixes an untriaged dangling pointer error.



Bug: 1121345

Change-Id: I1cfc624dbae69d0ab94af62cffa77805b1e23cf1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4451567

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Takumi Fujimoto

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1133564}

entry.title: bento_button: Rename existing desk bar view and desk bar view widget
entry.content:
In preparation of the new desk bar view for bento button, here this

renames `DesksBarView to `LegacyDeskBarView` and `VirtualDesksWidget` to

`OverviewDeskBarWidget`. It is intended to only change the bar view

class name, widget name, and file names so that it's easier to review.

Further cleanup for comments, variable names, function names, and class

names will also come incrementally as small pieces for the same reason.



There is no functionality change.



Bug: b:274836704

Test: unit tests, browser tests

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: Revert "float: Fix bounds after async minimum bounds change"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0cb77068069e0516e456aa9f9efe7963eae68491.



Reason for revert: TabletWindowFloatTest.MinimumSizeChangeOnTablet failing on ChromeOS ASAN LSAN



First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/50643/blamelist



Original change's description:

> float: Fix bounds after async minimum bounds change

>

> When entering tablet mode, the minimum bounds will change. For ash

> chrome this works fine since the operation is sync. For lacros chrome,

> the operation is async resulting in the bug. This patch moves the

> logic which handles changing the bounds of the floating window to

> when the widget size constraints change.

entry.title: geolocation: Introduce mojom::GeopositionResult
entry.content:
This CL adds a new mojom::GeopositionResult type to replace existing

uses of mojom::Geoposition that can either contain a position estimate

or an error.



The new type uses a Mojo union so the position and error cases are

mutually exclusive.

entry.title: Remove kAutofillEnableAccountWalletStorage flag enabled by default
entry.content:
This was enabled on most platforms for a long time, and got enabled

on ChromeOS in M112. So we can remove the flag.



One interesting aspect is that we keep some test coverage for

AutofillSyncSigninState::kSignedIn, which is still the correct

value until AUTOFILL_WALLET_DATA becomes active (from then on

kSignedInAndWalletSyncTransportEnabled).

entry.title: Add SIGTERM exception handler to run_wpt_tests:main

entry.content:
All PrintBackendBrowserTest tests launch and perform tests against a

Print Backend service. This means that they are always testing

behavior which would occur in an out-of-process printing scenario.



Update the PrintBackendBrowserTest setup to enable the

EnableOopPrintDrivers feature flag. This is relevant to ensure proper

behavior, since PrintBackend based classes can have some behavior which

differs based on this flag. This particularly matters when dealing with

the area of changes for printable area that were made in

https://crrev.com/1128325 and https://crrev.com/1131549.

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] 16/n: Activate `lint-wpt` in presubmit for changes
entry.content:
The change drops `blink_tool.py lint-wpt` into the existing `wpt lint`

presubmit. `lint-wpt` is a wrapper around `wpt lint` that not only lints

test files, as done currently, but also `.ini` metadata files that will

be frequently edited manually after switching to wptrunner.



Fix existing metadata issues to green the presubmit:

* `css/css-layout-api/fallback-*/constructor-error.https.html` are

reftests and should not have `ERROR`. However, just remove their

expectations because test history shows they pass now.

* `css/css-ui/appearance-cssom-001.html` was renamed to have a query

parameter in crrev.com/c/4391612. Delete the orphaned heading as well

as its baseline.

* Sort `fledge/tentative/auction-config.https.sub.window.js.ini`.



Linting all 5700+ `external/wpt/**/*.ini` files takes <7s because of

built-in parallelism, so performance is not a concern. Most changes

will touch just a few, or (currently) none at all.



Bug: 1406669

Test: ./blink_tool.py lint-wpt ../web_tests/external/wpt/**/*.ini

Test: All files OK.

Change-Id: I3b07f8409bc0d36b52a64f55f1c4f1fa6828d455

entry.title: Fix ScopedObservation UaF in BubbleDialogDelegate::AnchorWidgetObserver
entry.content:
A ScopedObservation can outlive the aura::Window it observes, leading to

a use-after-free error in ~ScopedObservation(). The problem occurs in

BubbleDialogDelegate::AnchorWidgetObserver. This fix listens for

OnWindowDestroying() and resets the observation to prevent the UaF.

entry.title: [Android][Reauth] Call reauthenticate when clicking on payments mandatory reauth toggle
entry.content:
Fourth CL for the Clank settings page implementation: For security, we

will require user authentication every time user trys to change this

Reauth preference. We invoke ReauthenticatorBridge.reauthenticate

to trigger the biometric auth, with useLastValidAuth=false to skip

the grace period.



Note that: We return false in the PreferenceChangeListener so that

it holds the toggle to still display the old value while waiting for

biometric auth. Once biometric is completed (either succeed or fail),

OnResume will reload the page with the pref value, which will switch

to the new value if biometric auth succeeded. We also simulate this

(OnResume) in unittest.



This is the last CL for the settings page toggle. The following CL

is to invoke biometric check when user click on the local card widget.



Implementation: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QmQdJzCOQVlYmFXmys3q3xNySROMc-eD/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-XTf-lgZWmiXC_0SZMd57kg

(last two cases are cancelling the auth, toggle stays as the old value)



Bug: 1427216

entry.title: Update periodicWave.html to test with 8192 elements
entry.content:
The Web Audio specification says the following:

"A conforming implementation MUST support PeriodicWave up to at least

8192 elements."



https://www.w3.org/TR/webaudio/#PeriodicWave



This CL increases the length of arrays used in the existing WPT from

4096 to 8192.



Note that it is ont clear what "support" means in this context:

https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/1415



A different test may be requried if "support" means that all

supplied coefficients up to 8192 must be used to generate the waveform.

entry.title: gif rendering: Add FilePreviewController
entry.content:
Passing around `FilePreviewImageSkiaSource` with an API to control

animation and invalidation would rely on callers to handle lifetime

guarantees. Instead, we want to provide them with a `ui::ImageModel`

ready to use with a `views::ImageView` and a controller that is

guaranteed to have a lifetime longer than the corresponding

`ui::ImageModel` without causing a memory leak.



This is the first step in that: Adding a controller that provides the

caller with an interface to control animation and listen for

invalidation. A `FilePreviewFactory` to create the `ui::ImageModel`s and

manage the lifetimes will follow.



Bug: b:278602934

Change-Id: If001ac79658bd0b2e31e2c4b67708abd601f4b8d

entry.title: arc/gio: Replace the overlay widget observer
entry.content:
The overlay WidgetObserver was added for fullscreen/immersive launch.

Because it needs to replace the overlay in ShellSurface for new

upcoming changes, this CL removes the overlay WidgetObserver

and overrides another window observer function to simplify the

implementation.



For ARC window, the caption is auto hidden when in fullscreen mode.

When ARC window is launched as fullscreen, the immersive state is

enabled later than the display overlay is added and the caption height

is considered there. When the caption is auto-hidden, it doesn't

trigger OnWindowBoundsChanged(). So the overlay bounds are not updated.



It needs to add observer as:

1) WindowStateObserver to check if the window is set to fullscreen.

or 2) WindowObserver to check if the property of kImmersiveIsActive is

set true.



Option 2) is picked since there is WindowObserver already.



Bug: b/275380988

Test: unit_tests ArcInputOverlayManagerTest

Test: manual check the window launched fullscreen

Change-Id: Id2c930105599eee50e27df8eda20ec9e8332b6d3

entry.title: ext approvals: Cancel approval request if requester was deleted
entry.content:
Supervised users require parent approval for an extension installation.

Approval request can originate from the browser tab and the corresponding

web contents is then passed to the request. Showing the approval might

require an asyn data fetch (extension icon) and the browser tab or

window can be closed meanwhile. This cases UAF for the web contents.



In order to prevent UAF this cl uses weak ptr to the web contents and

cancels the approval if the web contents was deleted during the async

data fetch.



Note: We assume that once the async data fetch is finished the UI is modal

or system modal and the browser window/tab cannot be closed before the

request is completed.



Bug: b:269577291

Change-Id: I7dab1bfd4b291b1da2a390110aa720ac1f465ca0

entry.title: Make SharedDictionaryStorage keyed by NetworkIsolationKey and Origin
entry.content:
Currently SharedDictionaryStorage is keyed only by NetworkIsolationKey.

The NetworkIsolationKey is the same for the same site pages even if they

are in different origins. So the same SharedDictionaryStorage is used

for such sites (eg: map.example.com vs mail.example.com.).

This is unintentional. The SharedDictionaryStorage must be keyed also by

Origin.



To make SharedDictionaryStorage keyed by NetworkIsolationKey and Origin,

this CL introduces a new class SharedDictionaryStorageIsolationKey and

use it as a key of SharedDictionaryStorage.

entry.title: [Extensions] Introduce a ChannelType enum for messaging
entry.content:
We have three different basic messaging methods in extensions:

- sendMessage

- sendRequest (deprecated)

- connect



(These also have different variants -- e.g., runtime.sendMessage(),

runtime.sendNativeMessage(), and tabs.sendMessage() are all

"sendMessage" channels.)



While sendMessage and sendRequest are, conceptually, single-use

messages, they still require the full instantiation of a message

channel in the underlying messaging infrastructure.



Today, the type of channel is indicated by the `channel_name`,

where the `channel_name` for the one-time message method (sendMessage

and sendRequest) is that of the method. But for connect()-style

methods, the extension can provide a channel name, making it

possible for them to provide a reserved name.



Instead of relying on `channel_name`, introduce an enum, `ChannelType`,

to indicate the type of channel a connection is.



This CL adds the new enum and completes the plumbing on the renderer

side (from API call to the point the IPC to the browser is sent), but

does not plumb the enum through the browser back to the target

renderer (which will be handled in a followup CL).

entry.title: Use VMA and not file offset for .text with gdb
entry.content:
In objdump the 5th, 6th, and 7th fields are the VMA, LMA, and file

offset, respectively. These fields are the same for many binaries, but

for recent chrome binaries the VMA and LMA are the file offset + 0x1000.

From recent experience, it appears that gdb is making the calculation

for add-symbol-file based on the VMA, so update the documentation to use

field 5.



Change-Id: Ib49c18abce03a99ce49bc0b4241c3b64b229508a

entry.title: Reduce shards autosharded suites + SQL change for multiple shard_counts
entry.content:
For suites that were autosharded to have more shards, but now can go

back down to fewer shards (like from a regression being fixed), we

can reduce the shard count. This is limited to only the suites that

have already been autosharded before. Shard increases are still

allowed on all suites regardless of whether they've been autosharded

in the past or not.



We want to make sure we're looking at the runtimes

for the most up-to-date shard counts. If the suite has already been

autosharded, the value in the autoshard_exceptions.json file lets us

know the current shard value. However, for non-autosharded suites,

there could be multiple recent shard values if they were manually

updated and a row for each builder+test_suite+shard_count is

returned by the query. `most_used_shard_count` was added to each row

to provide us a "best guess" for what the current shard value is. If

the most_used_shard_count matches the current row's `shard_count`,

then we'll update that row if it suggests an increase.



Bug: 1418199

Change-Id: I82be85338b6bc3e6318b983d1578823655d07a66

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4443070

Commit-Queue: Stephanie Kim

Reviewed-by: Struan Shrimpton

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1133419}

entry.title: [Browsing Data Model] Integrate Quota Managed Data
entry.content:
In this CL:



- Moved `browsing_data_quota_helper` from

`chrome/browser/browsing_data/` to `components/browsing_data/`



- Updated `QuotaInfo` to use `blink::StorageKey` instead of

`std::string host`



- Behind `kDeprecateCookiesTreeModel` feature utilised

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/test: Add H.264 Process SPS Function
entry.content:
The H.264 decoder previously parsed SPS NALU's and only used the SPS to

initialize and transmit the H.264 SPS Ctrl struct to the device. While

this works on some bitstreams, the SPS also contains additional decoding

parameters such as the bit depth and profile.



This change updates the decoder to include a new ProcessSPS function

which will take a sps_id and parse decoding parameters from it. The

max_num_reorder_frames_ is calculated from the SPS which will be used

decoding frame buffering. This function extracts the profile, bit depth,

and pic_size from the SPS as well. If any of these characteristics are

different from the current configuration, this would indicate a new

sequence configuration and will be used in a future CL to indicate where

the DPB would need to be cleared.



This update adds no new bitstream decoding functionality. However, this

update will be be essential in further CL's towards decoding additional

bitstreams.



BUG=b:234752983

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=BA1_Sony_D.h264 --md5=checksums.log

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=CVSE2_Sony_B.h264 --md5=checksums.log

entry.title: Add SafeBrowsingExtensionProtectionAllowed policy for CrOS
entry.content:
Add policy definition, pref, and policy to pref mapping. This policy

allows admins to disable Safe Browsing extension blocklist data

from being sent to Google servers. If

SafeBrowsingExtensionProtectionAllowed is true, extension blocklist

through Safe Browsing will follow existing behavior from

SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel. If the new policy is false,

SafeBrowsingExtensionProtectionAllowed will override

SafeBrowsingProtectionLevel and disable Safe Browsing extension

blocklist, preventing extensions blocklist from sending data

to Google servers for a final verdict.



This policy does not impact extension blocklist controlled by Omaha.

Disabling this policy effectively acts like disabling Safe Browsing

for extension blocklist.



Unit/browser tests have been added to:

- Confirm new behavior with policy disabled

- Confirm policy does not impact Omaha blocklist

When passwords are identified as reused, all the credentials with the

same password are grouped together (reused group). If all the

passwords in that group are deleted or modified except for one, that

entry.title: Improve performance of HashMgr::InitHashEntry
entry.content:
Hunspell's HashMgr::InitHashEntry is called for every entry in the

dictionary. Each time it is called, it initializes a FileMgr object.

That FileMgr object is only used if there is a parser error. Should

there be an error, it reports the line number. However, because the

line number doesn't help identify the place which caused the parser

error in a BDICT file, FileMgr::getlinenum() always returns 0. Since

we don't actually need a unique FileMgr object in this scenario, make

it static. This improves performance in instances where the dictionary

is quite large (e.g. German).

entry.title: Add metrics for navigation-source-linked buffering
entry.content:
- Conversions.RegisterDataHostOutcome: Will be useful to know if we are

indeed reducing the number of buffered registrations. Since it is now

navigation linked, most registrations should be handled immediately. The

metric will also allow to validate the limit size, few should be

dropped.

receivers should be bound when the source registration completes. This

metric will allow us to know how many are bound due to a timeout. It

will also be used to validate the current 10s timeout.

impact of deferring the registration on registration time.

entry.title: [omnibox][post-ac] Fix switch-to-tab on android with debouncing.
entry.content:
`AutocompleteController` owns an `AutocompeleteResult` `result_`.



Debouncing introduced a buffered `published_result_`. `result_` would be

the latest results, but `published_result_` would be the externally

visible results.



`published_result_` was updated in `NotifyChanged()` with:

`published_result_.CopyFrom(result_)`. This copies the matches, and

copied matches don't inherit `java_match_` and `matching_java_tab_`.

`matching_java_tab_` is computed in `ConvertOpenTabMatches()` on

`result_` for the last autocomplete pass.



So the flow on android ended up being:

1. Last autocomplete pass finishes.

2. Matches in `result_` have their `matching_java_tab_` computed.

3. Matches are copied from `result_` to `published_result_`. The former

will retain `matching_java_tab_`. The latter will not inherit

`matching_java_tab_`.

4. Android tries to look at `matching_java_tab_` on the

`published_result_`, can't find them, and fails to execute

switch-to-tab.



This CL fixes this by changing step 3.

3. Matches are swapped, not copied, from `result_` to

`published_result_`. Then they are copied back from

`published_result_` to `result_`. This means `published_result_` will

'steal' `matching_java_tab_` from `result_`.



Bug: 1431888, 1340291

Change-Id: I1cdfe862eda3d4fd7b538207e742e044699d759a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4445246

Commit-Queue: manuk hovanesian

Reviewed-by: Tomasz Wiszkowski

Code-Coverage: Findit

used in Grid mode for the TabUiThemeProvider.

entry.title: chromeos: kKstaledRatio default value is 0
entry.content:
/sys/kernel/mm/lru_gen/enabled is a bit mask for MGLRU component features. Each bit is a flag for a particular MGLRU capability, which may or may not be available on a particular architecture [1]. Set a default value of 0 (preventing any arch specific surprises) and permit values up to 0xff. Since MGLRU is now default on all CrOS kernels, KstaledRatio is no longer called, so this default value will have no impact on MGLRU settings. Upcoming experiments will selectively set/unset the desired components, thus the permitted range must increase.



[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/mm/multigen_lru.html



BUG=b:278886973



Change-Id: I5bebf706c95af24903d66d1094ae3253cb4304d5

entry.title: Fix race condition in attribution WPT
entry.content:
When registering a source via a navigation. It uses a data decoder to

parse the headers. The current test setup had a race condition between

the header parsing and registering the trigger.



When the trigger registered first, it did not match any sources and the

test failed.



In this CL, we use source-success debug report as an indicator that the

source completed processing before registering the trigger. This removes

the race condition.



We also remove the logs that were added to understand the issue.



Bug: 1415441

Change-Id: I5050fdeb64c12b6d5f059632b275607d2c9cba07

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4455172

Reviewed-by: Andrew Paseltiner

Commit-Queue: Anthony Garant

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1133379}
